description: Prior approval for the extension of existing station building to: roof over car-parking area, creation of operations room and associated staff facilities, erection of railings at roof level, creation of secondary station entrance/exit beneath the new roof together with provision of boswick security gates, and the erection of a wall in place of the secondary entrance/exit until such time as that entrance is provided.
site_name: Highbury And Islington Underground Railway Station
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  The metal panels which form the temporary infill shall be constructed as approved and maintained as such until such time as the permanent secondary entrance/exit has been provided, fitted out and is capable to be used for its ultimate intended use as a dedicated secondary entrance/exit to the station.

Prior approval for bostwick gates is only granted in the instance where those gates would form security gates for the completed secondary station entrance/exit to be located beneath the new roof.  Prior approval is not granted for the installation of bostwick gates for the interim period when the secondary entrance/exit has not been provided and a void space would exist behind the gates.

REASON:  The provision bostwick gates within the infill area, prior to the use of this space as a station entrance/exit, would have a harmful visual impact and would be injurious to neighbouring amenity.
